title: Reducing Food Waste at Home
body: Plan your meals, use leftovers creatively, and store food properly to extend shelf life and reduce waste.

title: Ethically Sourced Coffee Explained
body: Ethically sourced coffee ensures farmers are paid fair wages and environmental standards are upheld during production.

title: Restaurants Fighting Food Waste
body: Many restaurants now offer discounts on meals prepared earlier in the day to reduce waste and save you money.

title: Understanding Fair Trade Labels
body: Fair Trade labels guarantee that products were produced ethically, with fair wages and safe working conditions.

title: Tips to Store Food Smarter
body: Keep fruits and vegetables in the right humidity, freeze leftovers, and label stored food with dates to waste less.

title: Apps Helping Reduce Food Waste
body: Apps like Too Good To Go and OLIO connect people with unsold food from restaurants and neighbors to prevent waste.

title: Sustainable Seafood Choices
body: Choose seafood certified by MSC or ASC to ensure it’s caught or farmed with minimal environmental impact.

title: Composting 101: Reduce Organic Waste
body: Turn your kitchen scraps into nutrient-rich compost to reduce landfill waste and enrich your garden soil.

title: The True Cost of Cheap Food
body: Low prices can mean environmental harm and labor exploitation—choose local and ethical products when possible.

title: How to Shop More Sustainably
body: Bring reusable bags, buy seasonal produce, and choose items with less packaging to lower your food footprint.
